meanings.definition: Not directly caused by or resulting from something
meanings.sent1: The detective found some indirect evidence that led to the suspect.
meanings.sent2: She took an indirect route to avoid the traffic.
meanings.sent3: The indirect hint about the surprise party made her curious.
meanings.sent4: His indirect approach to problem-solving always yielded creative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The indirect impact of the new policy was felt across the organization.

meanings.sent1: Her indirect answer left everyone confused.
meanings.sent2: The author used indirect language to convey the message.
meanings.sent3: His indirect compliment made her smile.
meanings.sent4: The indirect reference to the past brought back memories.
meanings.sent5: The indirect implication of his words was clear to those who listened carefully.

meanings.definition: Not following a straight line or course
meanings.sent1: The river took an indirect path through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The indirect sunlight filtered through the trees.
meanings.sent3: The indirect flight of the butterfly caught her attention.
meanings.sent4: The indirect route up the mountain was challenging but scenic.
meanings.sent5: The indirect wind carried the scent of flowers from afar.
